draw from: To draw something such as water or energy from a particular source means to take it from that source.
shore up: If you shore up something that is weak or about to fail, you do something in order to strengthen it or support it.
or otherwise: You use or otherwise to mention something that is not the thing just referred to.
contribute to: If you contribute to something, you say or do things to help to make it successful.
coincide with: If one event coincides with another, they happen at the same time.
in favor of: If you are in favor of something, you support it and think that it is a good thing.
